action_list.description: System action for creating an application
action_list.name: action_create

action_list.description: System action for deleting an application. Deletes created VMs as well
action_list.name: action_delete

action_list.description: System action for starting an application
action_list.name: action_start

action_list.description: System action for stopping an application
action_list.name: action_stop

action_list.description: System action for restarting an application
action_list.name: action_restart

attrs.script:
Write-Output "Removing computer account from AD"
Write-Output ""

$uname = "@@{domaindeploycred.username}@@"
$passwd = ConvertTo-SecureString -AsPlainText '@@{domaindeploycred.secret}@@' -Force

$cred = New-Object System.Management.Automation.PSCredential ($uname,$passwd)

$Computers = "@@{RunExternalPowershell.availableName}@@"
$Computers = $Computers.Trimend(",")

$CompArray = @()
$CompArray = $Computers.split(",")

ForEach ($Computer in $CompArray){
    #Test if the computer is responding to ping
    $ConnectionTest = Test-Connection -ComputerName $Computer -Count 2 -Delay 1 -Quiet

    #If the computer fails to respond to ping, remove the computer account
    If ($ConnectionTest -eq $false){  
        Write-Output "Computer $Computer is not responding to ping. It's account will be deleted from AD"
        Remove-ADComputer -Identity $Computer -Confirm:$false -Credential $cred
    }
    
    #If the computer replies to ping, do not remove the computer account
    If ($ConnectionTest -eq $true) {
        Write-Output "Computer $Computer is responding to ping. It's account will not be deleted from AD"
    }

    $ConnectionTest = $null

}

Write-Output "Enabling CredSSP"

#Enable credssp for double-hop issues
Enable-WSManCredSSP -Role Server -Force

Write-Output "Disabling CredSSP"

#Disable credssp for double-hop issues
Disable-WSManCredSSP -Role Server
